tool_description: This API helps to query for business news and live market data to create a financial site such as cnn.com
name: CNN Business
title: CNN Business

api_list.name: Futures
api_list.description:
## Futures Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves data for futures.

### Endpoint

`GET /futures`

### Request

```http
GET /futures
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://cnn-business.p.rapidapi.com/futures"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "cnn-business.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://cnn-business.p.rapidapi.com/futures"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "cnn-business.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: ETFs Most Active
api_list.description:
## ETFs Most Active Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves data for the most active ETFs.

### Endpoint

`GET /etfs-ma`

### Parameters

- `limit` (optional): The maximum number of most active ETFs to return (default is 7).

### Request

```http
GET /etfs-ma?limit=7

api_list.name: Stock Decliners
api_list.description:
## Stock Decliners Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves data for stock decliners.

### Endpoint

`GET /stock-decliners`

### Parameters

- `limit` (optional): The maximum number of stock decliners to return (default is 7).
- `page` (optional): The page number for paginated results (default is 1).

### Request

```http
GET /stock-decliners?limit=7&page=1

api_list.name: Stock Gainers
api_list.description:

This endpoint retrieves data for stock gainers.

### Endpoint

`GET /stock-gainers`

### Parameters

- `limit` (optional): The maximum number of stock gainers to return (default is 7).
- `page` (optional): The page number for paginated results (default is 1).

### Request

```http
GET /stock-gainers?limit=7&page=1

api_list.name: Market Index
api_list.description:
## Market Index Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves market index data for a specified date.

### Endpoint

`GET /market-index`

### Parameters

- `date` (required): The date for which market index data is requested. Format: `YYYY-MM-DD`.

### Request

```http
GET /market-index?date=YYYY-MM-DD

api_list.name: World Markets
api_list.description:
## World Markets Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves world markets data for specified regions and date.

### Endpoint

`GET /world-markets`

### Parameters

- `regions` (optional): The regions for which world markets data is requested. Permitted values: 'America', 'Americas', 'Europe', 'APAC', 'Asia-Pacific', 'EMEA', or a combination separated by commas. Default: 'Americas,Asia-Pacific,Europe'.
- `date` (required): The date for which world markets data is requested. Format: `YYYY-MM-DD`.

### Request

```http
GET /world-markets?regions=Americas,Asia-Pacific,Europe&date=2024-03-28

optional_parameters.name: regions
optional_parameters.description: Default: 'Americas,Asia-Pacific,Europe'. Permitted values: 'America', 'Americas', 'Europe', 'APAC', 'Asia-Pacific', 'EMEA', or a combination separated by commas.

api_list.name: Events Calendar
api_list.description:
## Events Calendar Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves events from a calendar within a specified date range.

### Endpoint

`GET /events-calendar`

### Parameters

- `sdate` (required): The start date of the date range. Format: `YYYY-MM-DD`.
- `edate` (required): The end date of the date range. Format: `YYYY-MM-DD`.
- `page` (optional): The page number for paginated results (default is 1).

### Request

```http
GET /events-calendar?sdate=YYYY-MM-DD&edate=YYYY-MM-DD&page=1

api_list.description:

### Parameters

api_list.name: Recommendation
api_list.description:
## Recommendation Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves stock recommendations.

### Endpoint

`GET /recommendation`

### Parameters

- `limit` (optional): The maximum number of recommendations to return (default is 5).

### Request

```http
GET /recommendation?limit=5

api_list.name: Report
api_list.description:
## Report Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves a report for a given stock.

### Endpoint

`GET /report`

### Parameters

- `ticker` (required): The ticker symbol for which the report is requested.
- `timePeriod` (optional): The time period for the report (default is 1D).

### Request

```http
GET /report?ticker=AMZN&timePeriod=1D

required_parameters.name: ticker
required_parameters.description: Please provide symbol similar to that found on CNN, Yahoo, or Google.

api_list.name: Stock Analysis Overview
api_list.description:
## Stock Analysis Overview Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves the analysis overview for a given stock.

### Endpoint

`GET /stock-analysis-overview`

### Parameters

- `ticker` (required): The ticker symbol for which the analysis overview is requested.

### Request

```http
GET /stock-analysis-overview?ticker=AMZN

required_parameters.name: ticker
required_parameters.description: Please provide symbol similar to that found on CNN, Yahoo, or Google.

api_list.name: Mostly Active Stocks
api_list.description:
## Actives Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves active stocks data.

### Endpoint

`GET /actives`

### Parameters

- `limit` (optional): The maximum number of active stocks to return (default is 10).

### Request

```http
GET /actives?limit=10

api_list.name: Charting
api_list.description:
## Charting Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves charting data for a given ticker symbol.

### Endpoint

`GET /charting`

### Parameters

- `ticker` (required): The ticker symbol for which charting data is requested.
- `timePeriod` (optional): The time period for which the charting data is requested (default is 1D). Valid values are: `1D`, `1W`, `1M`, `3M`, `1Y`.

### Request

```http
GET /charting?ticker=AMZN&timePeriod=1D

- `limit` (optional): The maximum number of competitors to return (default is 7).

### Request

required_parameters.name: ticker
required_parameters.description: Please provide symbol similar to that found on CNN, Yahoo, or Google.
